word_mean: 食欲：一种天然欲望，尤指自然而反复的对食物的欲望

sentence.Network_en: There is nothing like a long walk to arouse the appetite.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有什么比走很长的路更能激起食欲的了。

sentence.Network_en: Symptoms are a slight fever, headache and loss of appetite.
sentence.Network_cn: 症状包括低烧、头痛和食欲不振。

sentence.Network_en: The public has an insatiable appetite for stories about the famous.
sentence.Network_cn: 公众对名人有着难以满足的好奇心。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French apetit (modern appétit), from Latin appetitus 'desire for', from appetere 'seek after', from ad- 'to' + petere 'seek'

entry.def: Your appetite is your desire to eat.

example.ex: Symptoms are a slight fever, headache and loss of appetite.
example.tran: 症状包括低烧、头痛和食欲不振。

entry.def: Someone's appetite for something is their strong desire for it.

example.tran: 美国人对丑闻日益增强的好奇心

sentences.sentence: "the object of life is to satisfy as many appetencies as possible"- Granville Hicks

auth_sentence.content: It's an invigorating debut, auspicious and appetite-whetting.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's an invigorating debut, auspicious and appetite-whetting.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's an invigorating debut, auspicious and appetite-whetting.

auth_sentence.content: I did and it killed my appetite for chips.
auth_sentence.res_content: I did and it killed my appetite for chips.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I did and it killed my appetite for chips.

auth_sentence.content: But appetite for risk is only part of it.
auth_sentence.res_content: But appetite for risk is only part of it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But appetite for risk is only part of it.

stems_affixes.word_buile: centri=centr中心+pet追+al……的→追求中心的→向心的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有能力的,能胜任的;足够的
竞争的;好竞争的;[价格等的]有竞争力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compete[v.比赛,竞争]+itive……的→adj.竞争的;好竞争的;[价格等的]有竞争力的
per全部永久+pet追求,寻求+ual……的→追求永久的
pet追求,寻求+ulant多……的→追求太多,导致脾气不好
pro前+piti=pet追求,寻求+ous……的→在[别人]前面追到→幸运的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 食欲,胃口;欲望,性欲;爱好,趣味
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap一再+pet追求,寻求+ite表名词→一再追求→有胃口
appet=appetite胃口+izer东西→n.开胃食品,开胃物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 能力,胜任某种工作的资格
stems_affixes.word_buile: competent[[adj.有能力的,能胜任的;足够的]]省鷑.能力,胜任某种工作的资格
compete[v.比赛,竞争]+ition表名词→n.竞争, 竞赛
pet追求,寻求+ition表名词→追寻状态→请愿[词性变化:可做动词]
petition[n.请愿书,申请书 v.[向…]请愿,正式请求]+er人→n.请愿人
per全部,永久+pet追求,寻求+uate=ate表动词→追求永久
pet追求,寻求+ition表名词→追寻状态→请愿[词性变化:可做动词]
pro前+piti=pet追求,寻求+ate表动词→追到前面去→获宠爱

Sentence.sentence: In recent years, a growing body of research has shown that our appetite and food intake are influenced by a large number of factors besides our biological need for energy, including our eating environment and our perception of the food in front of us.
A new study suggested that our short-term memory also may play a role in appetite
This disparity (差异) suggests the memory of our previous meal may have a bigger influence on our appetite than the actual size of the meal.

sentences.en: He was a person of gross sexual appetites.
The baby has a good appetite.

jushi.english: The long walk gave her a good appetite.
jushi.chinese: 长途步行让她胃口大开。

jushi.english: A man must decide either to curb his appetites or surrender to them.
jushi.chinese: 一个人必须决定，或抑制其欲念，或向其欲念屈服。

jushi.english: This restaurant catered to large appetites and modest purses.
jushi.chinese: 这家饭馆向胃口很大但囊中羞涩的人供餐。
